speaker: Episodic Comedy (TV)
text: Joe Keenan  * * *  ## Transcript {nicholas hartley}    _Act One.  Scene One - Frasier's Apartment. Martin enters the apartment with Eddie.  Daphne is on the sofa with some video tapes.  Roz enters from the kitchen with a tray of wine._

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Martin.  Happy Valentine's Day.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh thanks, Roz.  So you're with us tonight, huh?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, we rented a couple of sad chick movies.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, it's not like you not to have a date on Valentine's Day.

speaker: Roz
text: Tell me, I usually try for a second seating! [_Martin laughs_]

speaker: Daphne
text: And you'd think that being engaged, I'd have a guaranteed date.  But no!  Donny had to go to Florida, his grandmother. She'd do anything to come between us.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, what did she do this time?

speaker: Daphne
text: She died.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good Lord, where is Niles?  I don't want to be late for the opera.

speaker: Roz
text: Are you going out with Niles on Valentine's Day?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's a subscription series, you see.  We got these tickets months ago, we had no idea what day this fell on.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_hopeful_] So Dr. Crane's not spending tonight with Mel?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, she's going out of town, some sort of medical conference. [_doorbell sounds_] You know, actually I'm sorry for Niles, but I'm rather glad to be having an old-fashioned boy's night out.

speaker: Niles
text: [_into phone_] I can't wait either, I'll see you in twenty minutes, Valentine. [_kisses into phone and hangs up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: That had better be the seat duster in our opera box!

speaker: Niles
text: No, it was Mel.  At the last minute she decided to skip her conference.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, I'll be going to the opera by myself?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, well here's a thought.  If you give Mel your opera ticket then you won't have to be alone.  You can stay here and watch fun movies with Roz and Daphne. [_looks at titles_] Ooh, "Dying Young" - it's a... classic.

speaker: Frasier
text: I am surprised by your gall!  At the last moment you not only bail on me, you expect me to give up my own ticket!

speaker: Niles
text: Please, Frasier, put yourself in my shoes.  I have to do something for Mel.  Every restaurant in town's been booked for weeks.  I ran into Archie Wilfong today.  He told me he had to settle for two seats at the counter at "The Salad Experience!"  What would you suggest I do?

speaker: Frasier
text: Bring your own wine and order the Spicy Caesar!

speaker: Niles
text: [_stalks to the door_] May your opera box be full of cellophane crinklers and the stage swarming with standbys.

speaker: Frasier
text: Get out!

speaker: Frasier
text: He goes too far!

speaker: Roz
text: [_sarcastic_] Yeah, some nerve - ditching you to spend Valentine's Day with his girlfriend.

speaker: Martin
text: Look, Fras, I don't blame you for being a little jealous cause he's got someone and you don't...

speaker: Frasier
text: I am not jealous, Dad, I'm simply appalled by his rudeness. I was looking forward to this evening. [_pouring himself a sherry_] Nice drink, lovely opera.  Then a late supper, perhaps a beautiful bottle of wine, delightful desert souffle... Oh God, I need a woman.

speaker: Daphne
text: Remember my friend Rowena?  She's much prettier since her surgery!  You look at her face and you can't even tell where it used to be.  [_N.B. In an earlier draft the line was, "you look at her face and can't even tell where the extra one was."_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Daphne.  But actually, I already have someone in mind.  You see, there's a stunning woman who comes to the opera on the same nights we do.  She has the box right across from ours.  We've flirted a bit from a distance.  I have laughed with her during "Figaro," cried with her during "Tosca," I even had a dream about her during "Einstein On The Beach."

speaker: Roz
text: Well, don't just stare at her, make a move!

speaker: Frasier
text: I will, Roz.  Tonight's the night.  By the finale I will have made my overture.  Dad, would you please come with me?

speaker: Martin
text: To the opera?  What do you need me for?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, I can't go with a woman because then she'll think I'm on a date, and if I go alone she'll think I couldn't get a date.

speaker: Roz
text: He would look pretty pathetic.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, geez!

speaker: Daphne
text: Or you could stay home with us and watch sad movies.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_reads a title_] "Sophie's Choice."

speaker: Martin
text: I'll say it is! **OUT WITH DAD** _Scene Two - Opera Box. Frasier and Martin are sat in the box._

speaker: Martin
text: Is she here yet?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, not yet.  That's her box over there, the empty one.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm not going to sit through a whole opera for some woman who's not even here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for God's sake, Dad, give it a chance.  You might actually learn to like it if you'd listen to one.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, your mother dragged to me a lot of these things when we were dating and they were all stupid.  These stories make no sense whatsoever.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that is not true!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, all right, what's this one about?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's about Rigoletto, the hunchbacked jester in the court of the Duke.  He has a daughter, Gilda, who's secretly living with him.  But everyone thinks that she's his mistress. In this opening scene, Rigoletto mocks the Duke's enemy, who puts a curse on him.

speaker: Martin
text: A cursed hunchback dating his daughter - well, nothing screwy so far!

speaker: Frasier
text: He is not dating his daughter!  Gilda is being courted by the Duke, who is disguised as a humble student.

speaker: Martin
text: You see, that's what I mean.  The whole thing's so unrealistic. Everybody's in love, pretending to be somebody they're not. And they're all swooning and gasping-

speaker: Martin
text: Exactly, who acts that way?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, she's here!  She's here, and she's not on a date.  That must be her mother.

speaker: Martin
text: [_looks and gasps_] Wow, you're right, she is a looker all right.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, don't gawk, don't gawk, she'll notice.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I thought that was the point.  You've got to get her attention.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Dad, please, don't wave!  Just keep your eye on the stage.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, but I bet you that gets results.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looks_] You're right, Dad, it did.

speaker: Martin
text: [_looks and gasps in horror; through a clenched jaw_] Oh God, I wasn't waving at her, I was waving at the daughter!

speaker: Frasier
text: That's not what the mother seems to think. [_laughs_] I think she likes you, wave back.

speaker: Martin
text: No, I don't want to.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wave back!  You started it, wave back to her.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, geez! [_reluctantly waves back_] _FADE TO:  Scene Three - Theatre Lobby. Martin and Frasier arrive from the box._

speaker: Martin
text: Hunchback's got kind of a nice voice, but the daughter's kinda screechy!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, she's no Renata Tebaldi.  Gosh, I don't see them, do you?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I bet you the old one's in the ladies room putting on more war paint!

speaker: Frasier
text: Here they are.  Just try to be nice, Dad!  If you are rude to the mother you will ruin my chances with the daughter! [_they come over_] Well, we finally meet.

speaker: Emily
text: I feel like we're practically old friends.

speaker: Helen
text: I'm Helen Browning, this is my daughter, Emily.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm Frasier Crane, this is my father, Martin.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, can we get you some champagne?

speaker: Emily
text: Oh, we'd love it, thanks.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh well, let me give you a hand.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, you know what, Dad, we can manage.  Er, why don't you two stay and have a nice little chat?

speaker: Helen
text: Lovely production, isn't it?  I adore Verdi.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, he's my favorite.

speaker: Helen
text: Though the woman singing Gilda's a bit off.

speaker: Martin
text: She's no Renata Tebaldi.

speaker: Helen
text: You know, if you like Verdi so much, I happen to have a spare ticket to "Aida" next week.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that sounds great, but, er, if it's a week from tonight, I'm busy, I'm sorry.

speaker: Helen
text: Actually, it's next Thursday.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Thursday?  Oh, you know there's this thing at my... at my wine club.

speaker: Helen
text: That's all right, Martin, we just met, I shouldn't have asked.

speaker: Martin
text: No, no, no, Helen, it's got nothing to do with you, it's me. I'm afraid I've given you the wrong impression of myself. You see, the truth is, I'm... [_thinks_]

speaker: Helen
text: Gay.

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, right, gay.

speaker: Helen
text: I thought you might be.  How many straight men remember Renata Tebaldi?

speaker: Martin
text: [_looks over at Frasier_] Not many! [_laughs_]

speaker: Helen
text: Well, I'm sorry if I was too forward, it's just that sometimes it's so hard to meet nice men.

speaker: Martin
text: Tell me! [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Here we are, Dad.  Actually, good news, Emily has agreed to join me for a night cap after the opera.  Cast her eye over my African art collection.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well...

speaker: Helen
text: Very nice meeting you.

speaker: Martin
text: Nice meeting you, too.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Emily_] I'll see you later.

speaker: Frasier
text: So how did it go with Helen?  You didn't offend her, did you?

speaker: Martin
text: No, not at all.  It turns out I'm not her type.

speaker: Emily
text: Well?

speaker: Helen
text: Opera Queen.

speaker: Emily
text: Oh, sorry.

speaker: Helen
text: Still, you know who he'd be perfect for?

speaker: Emily
text: [_excited_] Yes!  You know, he's here tonight!  I'll bring him.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, Dad, we better hurry up.  Don't want to miss the second act.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, who cares?  It'll be just more goofy stuff that never happens in real life. [_N.B. John Mahoney is, in real life, a big opera buff._] _End of Act One.  Act Two.  Scene One - Frasier's Apartment. Daphne and Roz are sobbing over a movie on the VCR as Frasier and Martin enter.  Martin leaves to the kitchen._

speaker: Daphne
text: How was the opera?

speaker: Frasier
text: Lovely.  Get out! [_turns television off_]

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, that movie's not over.

speaker: Frasier
text: Too bad, Roz.  There's a stunning woman on her way over here, I don't want her thinking I'm running some sort of maudlin sorority house.  Now, come on, shake a leg.

speaker: Roz
text: [_stands_] You actually spoke to her, you didn't wimp out?

speaker: Frasier
text: You have never seen me so suave.

speaker: Roz
text: [_goes to door_] Some Valentine's Day!  First my date bails on me and now I owe Daphne fifty bucks! _She exits, as Daphne exits to her room.  Frasier is not amused. Martin enters holding his beer up._

speaker: Martin
text: [_to his beer_] Well, hello there.  Will you be my "Ballantine"?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, will you go get a glass, please?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, all right. [_exits to kitchen_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_doorbell sounds_] And drink it quickly.  The last thing I need tonight is some third wheel cramping my style. _Frasier opens the door to Emily on the arm of a very English and very camp Edward._ [_N.B. Brian Bedford appeared in "Tales of the City" with Dan Butler._]

speaker: Edward
text: Hello! [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello.

speaker: Emily
text: I hope you don't mind.  Edward here was at the opera too, he's my partner.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_miffed_] Your partner?

speaker: Edward
text: At the gallery.  I'm also her uncle.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, [_laughs_] when you said partner, I thought you meant romantic partner.

speaker: Edward
text: [_horse laughs_] Hardly!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm Frasier.

speaker: Edward
text: [_enters_] Pleasure.  What a marvelous view! [_goes upstage_] May I?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, please.

speaker: Emily
text: Your father, is he dating anyone at the moment?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, no, but if you're thinking about your mother, I'm afraid they're not really right for each other.

speaker: Emily
text: [_laughs_] Yes, I know.  I meant Edward.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_surprised_] Your uncle?

speaker: Emily
text: Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: ...and my father?

speaker: Emily
text: They're both single, they love opera and they were both married with kids when they came out of the closet. Your dad told my mother all about it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, did he?

speaker: Emily
text: Well, she asked him out and he had to be honest with her. _Martin enters and notices Edward, who has just entered from the balcony._

speaker: Martin
text: Hi, there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, nothing like a little honesty to diffuse an awkward situation. _Martin notices nothing unusual about Edward.  To the contrary, he's pleased to meet someone his own age._

speaker: Martin
text: Hi there, how are you?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_taking Emily's coat_] Let me take your coat.  Dad, this is Edward, Emily's uncle, he's her partner in her art gallery. Er, Edward, this is my father, Martin.

speaker: Edward
text: [_shaking hands_] Pleased to meet you, Martin.

speaker: Martin
text: Same here, and my friends call me Marty.

speaker: Edward
text: Then Marty it is!  I love what you've done with this place, it's the perfect blend of sleek elegance and [_pointedly at chair_] audacious whimsy!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, you like it, huh?  Do you know, Edward's my favorite name.

speaker: Edward
text: Really?

speaker: Martin
text: Yes, I even called my dog Eddie. [_calls_] Eddie! [_Eddie rushes in_] Here he is.

speaker: Emily
text: Oh, a Jack Russell!  He loves Jack Russells.

speaker: Edward
text: I have three of them. [_to Eddie_] All girls.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, well, we ought to get them together.  Who knows, maybe a little romance'll bloom. [_Edward reacts_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Dad, maybe we should go fetch our new friends some drinks.

speaker: Emily
text: I'd love some white wine.

speaker: Martin
text: How about you, Ed?

speaker: Edward
text: Why not a beer?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, a man after my own heart. _Edward, encouraged, trades a look with Emily.  Reset to: Kitchen Frasier and Martin enter.  Frasier pours a glass of wine while Martin pours beer into a glass._

speaker: Frasier
text: Boy, you are really something!

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: You actually told Emily's mother that you were gay.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you said not to offend her, I thought that was a pretty good way to get her to cool her jets without hurting her feelings.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, there's something you don't understand.  You see, she told Emily.

speaker: Martin
text: She got a problem with it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh no, she's pretty okay with it.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I get it, you're worried she'll know I'm straight, find out I've been lying to her mother.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad...

speaker: Martin
text: Well, don't worry about it, I'll gay it up a little. _Reset to: Living Room Martin and Frasier enter the room with the drinks._

speaker: Martin
text: Emily, have I told you I love your hair.

speaker: Emily
text: Thank you, Martin.

speaker: Martin
text: It's di-vine. [_sits on couch next to Edward_]

speaker: Emily
text: [_looks at knickknacks_] Frasier, these pieces are wonderful, you've exquisite taste!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, he gets that from me.  Yes, it was worth all the hours I dragged him around to the museums and the antiques shops teaching him about art and, you know... upholstery.

speaker: Edward
text: Were you in the arts?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, well, actually, Ed-

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad was a cop.

speaker: Edward
text: Really? [_nudges him_] The, er, uniform and everything? [_laughs_]

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, in fact, er, that's what happened to my hip.  I took a bullet trying to break up a robbery.  Yeah, I called for back-up but it never showed up.

speaker: Emily
text: [_sighs in sympathy_] Because you were gay.

speaker: Martin
text: [_takes her hand_] Don't think I didn't wonder about that!

speaker: Martin
text: Yes, that was the day I came out. Lying in that alley, covered with blood, bullet in my hip and I said, "That's it! I'm gay, I like myself and I'm not living a lie anymore."

speaker: Edward
text: I had exactly the same experience when I came out. _Edward puts his hand on Martin's knee, to his surprise.  Martin's eyes bug out as he looks at the hand, then to Frasier, then back to the hand again.  Frasier just smirks at him._

speaker: Edward
text: Not, exactly, perhaps.  Yours was a bullet in the hip.  For me, it was a Lufthansa steward named Gunther.

speaker: Emily
text: [_holds Frasier's hand_] What did I tell you?  I knew they'd hit it off.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] Yes, I had a feeling myself.

speaker: Martin
text: And you didn't say a word, you scamp!  Er, Frasier, why don't you come help me get some snacks for everybody?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, if you'll excuse us. _Reset to: Kitchen Frasier and Martin enter and begin making snacks._

speaker: Martin
text: You didn't tell me this was a set-up!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, how blind can you be, Dad?  He didn't seem gay to you?

speaker: Martin
text: He's English, they all seem gay.

speaker: Frasier
text: Lord!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, we're just going to have to tell him the truth.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, what?  You found her mother so unattractive you pretended to be gay?!  Dad, Emily is the most fabulous woman I have met in ages.  If you screw this up for me, I will never forgive you, so just be nice, all right?

speaker: Martin
text: But what if he asks me for a date?

speaker: Frasier
text: I have news for you: You're on a date! _Reset to: Living Room They enter with the snacks to find Daphne chatting to the pair._

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne!

speaker: Edward
text: We've just been chatting with your delightful physical therapist, Marty.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, he's a charmer, this one. [_Edward laughs modestly; to Martin_] Now, aren't you glad you went to the opera? [_to Emily_] I keep telling him he should get out more, meet people.  Most nights he just sits here alone watching the telly.

speaker: Emily
text: [_re: Edward_] He's the exact same way.  He'll watch anything.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_re: Martin_] With him it's mostly sports.  Just give him a bunch of sweaty men chasing each other around the field and he...

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne! [_drags her to the kitchen_] Where are we keeping the Camembert these days?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_protesting_] Same place we always do.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_pushes her into kitchen_] Get in the kitchen!

speaker: Emily
text: You were smart to hire a woman for physical therapy.  Much safer than a man.  Edward sprained his leg last year.

speaker: Edward
text: All right, Emily.

speaker: Emily
text: I never trusted that man.

speaker: Edward
text: [_annoyed_] All right, Emily.

speaker: Emily
text: And why you loaned him your boat...

speaker: Edward
text: [_angry_] All right, Emily! _He chuckles weakly and shrugs at Martin.  Then from the kitchen they hear Daphne laughing herself silly.  Frasier enters with the cheese, pretending he made a joke._

speaker: Frasier
text: Here we are.

speaker: Emily
text: Thank you, Frasier.  I would love to see the rest of the apartment, if it's no trouble.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why, that's no trouble at all.

speaker: Martin
text: [_worried_] Frasier, can I just...

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, Dad, don't worry.  I will close the door to your room. [_to Edward_] You should see it whenever he gets ready for the opera - clothes everywhere!

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'm off to bed.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no, no, no, Daph.  Daphne, why don't you join us?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_trying to contain her laughter_] Oh, no, no: Three's a crowd! [_exits in a giggle_] the exact same fix in[[2.03]](/frasier/transcripts/season_2/episode_3/the_matchmaker.html "The Matchmaker"), "The Matchmaker."_]  Martin sits with Edward. _

speaker: Edward
text: So.

speaker: Martin
text: So...

speaker: Edward
text: Our loved ones seem determined to thrust us together.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, don't let them pressure you. _Martin is about to put his arm on the couch but then stops, realizing it looks like a come-on._

speaker: Edward
text: Congratulations, Marty, on having raised such a splendid son. I envy you your bond. [_Martin gets nervous_]

speaker: Martin
text: Do you have kids?

speaker: Edward
text: Just one, George.  He's thirty-five and he has consecrated his life [_in horror_] to bowling.  I join him when I can, but...

speaker: Martin
text: You're not wild about it.

speaker: Edward
text: No.  I mean, oh, the shoes!  Strange isn't it, the things we'll do to be close to our children.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah.  I've let Frasier drag me to all kinds of places I didn't want to go to, just so that I could spend some time with him.  You know, sometimes it's hard to humor your kids but...

speaker: Edward
text: [_puts his arm on the couch_] It's what we do, we're fathers.

speaker: Martin
text: Exactly. _Both men are aware that a nice rapport has been established - for Martin, uncomfortably so._

speaker: Edward
text: Marty, would you be free for dinner sometime?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, gee, I, er...

speaker: Edward
text: No, it's all right, never mind.

speaker: Martin
text: No, no, no, I'd love to, it's just that...

speaker: Edward
text: No need to explain.

speaker: Martin
text: No, no, really.  It's not you, you're a great guy, it's just that I'm... [_obviously contrived_] dating someone!

speaker: Edward
text: Marty, you don't have to spare my feelings.

speaker: Martin
text: No, no, really, it's true.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Martin
text: Darling! [_hugs Niles_]

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry, am I interrupting something?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, not a thing, honey.  Just take off your coat and stay a while.

speaker: Niles
text: Okay. [_does so_] I felt bad about that squabble earlier so I dropped off this little peace offering.

speaker: Martin
text: [_takes wine_] As if I could stay mad at you.  Er, this is my boyfriend, Niles.  Niles, this is Edward, we met at the opera tonight.

speaker: Edward
text: Delighted.

speaker: Niles
text: [_confused_] Hello.

speaker: Edward
text: You needn't look so startled.  I can assure you, there's nothing funny going on.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, good.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, why don't we go put this on ice? _Martin takes his confused son in to the kitchen as Frasier and Emily arrive chatting._

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course the finest Gilda ever sung was by the great Mathilde DeCagny.  I actually have a recording.

speaker: Emily
text: I'd love to hear it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Where's Dad?

speaker: Edward
text: He's in the kitchen with his boyfriend.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh! [_confused_] Niles, what brings you here?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, it's my place too! [_laughs_] I can have company if I want.  Emily, this is Niles.

speaker: Emily
text: [_coldly_] Hello.

speaker: Niles
text: Hi.

speaker: Emily
text: [_aside to Frasier_] Em, I didn't realize your father was seeing someone.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, actually, I didn't think he was.  Since when were you two an item?

speaker: Martin
text: Two weeks now.  We didn't say anything about it, yet, because, well... [_looks at Niles for an excuse_]

speaker: Niles
text: So many reasons.

speaker: Edward
text: You know, it's getting late, Emily.

speaker: Emily
text: Oh yes, we should be going.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, please, please, stay for just five more minutes. I have a very special old port that I'd love for you to sample. _Frasier goes into the kitchen beckoning Niles.  Niles tries to go, however he is stopped by Martin clinging on to him.  Niles whacks his arm, freeing himself.  Reset to: Kitchen Niles and Frasier enter.  Frasier hurriedly pours three glasses of port._

speaker: Frasier
text: How can you do this to me?

speaker: Niles
text: This was not my idea!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, Emily just kissed me in the bedroom and now she's leaving.  I have never been so embarrassed in my life.

speaker: Niles
text: You're embarrassed?!  They think the best I can do is an old man with a cane!

speaker: Frasier
text: You've got to fix this!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, and how am I supposed to do that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, isn't it obvious?  You've got to dump Dad!

speaker: Frasier
text: Here you are.  Really, you must try this.  So, Niles, actually, you missed a splendid evening at the opera.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, maybe I can catch it this weekend with Mel.

speaker: Martin
text: [_"jealous"_] Oh, and who's Mel?

speaker: Niles
text: [_"exploding"_] Damn you and your jealous questions, you don't own me! _Niles walks to get his coat after being given a sign of approval from Frasier._

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, I was only asking!

speaker: Niles
text: [_walks to door_] You're always asking, badgering, spying on me! Well, I won't be suffocated anymore.  I'm tired of being your trophy boy!  It's over, you hear me?  Over! [_haughty sniff_] And I'm keeping the jewelry!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_nearly laughing_] Oh, Dad, I'm so sorry.

speaker: Emily
text: If there's anything we can do...

speaker: Martin
text: No, I'll be all right, I... I guess I always knew it wouldn't last.

speaker: Edward
text: Marty, the young ones never stay.

speaker: Emily
text: I know what will cheer you up, that "Rigoletto" recording.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, splendid.

speaker: Edward
text: You know, Emily, I'd love to hear it but that shipment is arriving bright and early. [_stands_]

speaker: Emily
text: [_disheartened_] Oh, right.  Frasier, I wish I could stay, but I'm Edward's ride.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, what a shame.  Well, I guess this is good night, then-

speaker: Martin
text: [_stands_] No, no, wait a minute.  Emily, em, why don't you just stay here with Frasier and enjoy the music. [_gets his coat_] I'll give Edward a ride home.

speaker: Frasier
text: You would do that, Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Happy Valentine's Day, son.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_overjoyed_] Thanks, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, good night. _They all give their farewells as Martin and Edward exit.  Frasier switches on the opera recording and sits on the couch with Emily._

speaker: Emily
text: It was so sweet of your father to do that.  He really loves you, doesn't he?

speaker: Frasier
text: You have no idea. _As she snuggles up to him, a romantic aria begins, and we FADE OUT.  End of Act Two._
